abstract: Russian and American military officials, despite strained relations between two governments, are communicating via special hotline as both countries send fighter jets over Syrian airspace to combat Islamic State group fighters; strategy was developed in 2015 as way of addressing dangers of midair catastrophe.

headline.print_headline: A Hotline for Americans and Russians to Avoid Catastrophe in Syrian Skies
headline.main: A Hotline for Americans and Russians to Avoid Catastrophe in Syrian Skies

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: American and Russian officers talk three times a week to “deconflict,” military jargon for an effort to call ahead to avoid disaster in the skies over Syria....
lead_paragraph: American and Russian officers talk three times a week to “deconflict,” military jargon for an effort to call ahead to avoid disaster in the skies over Syria.
